title: University of Florida Professors Allege School Leaders Violated First Amendment Rights
sub_head: Officials’ decision to bar professors from testifying in court case against state has sparked criticism from academics, lawmakers
body:
A controversy at the University of Florida moved to the courthouse Friday, as three political-science professors who had been barred from providing expert testimony sued the institution’s president, provost and board of trustees.
Professors Sharon Austin, Michael McDonald and Daniel Smith allege in their lawsuit that the university’s decision to not allow them to be paid experts in a voting-rights lawsuit against the state of Florida was a violation of their First Amendment rights.
